section.heading: Amendment or restatement of certificate of trust; statement of correction.

para.text: A certificate of trust may be amended or restated at any time.
To amend its certificate of trust, a statutory trust shall deliver to the Mayor for filing an amendment stating the:
Date of filing of its initial certificate; and
Changes to the certificate as most recently amended or restated.
To restate its certificate of trust, a statutory trust must deliver to the Mayor for filing a restatement designated as such in its heading.

A trustee that knows or has reason to know that information in a filed certificate of trust was inaccurate when the certificate was filed or has become inaccurate due to changed circumstances shall promptly:
Cause the certificate to be amended; or
If appropriate, deliver to the Mayor for filing a statement of change under § 29-104.07 or a statement of correction under § 29-102.05.

annoGroup.heading: Section References
annoGroup.annotation: This section is referenced in § 29-1202.05 and § 29-1209.01.

annoGroup.heading: Effect of Amendments
annoGroup.annotation: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-210 rewrote the section.

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.text: Uniform Law: This section is based on § 202 of the Uniform Statutory Trust Entity Act.
Application of Law 19-210: Section 7 of D.C. Law 19-210 provided that the act shall apply as of January 1, 2012.
